description: compile.json controls the qx compile command, and while you can use command line parameters to compile an application, most applications will require one.
title: compile.json Schema

___eslintConfig.description: The syntax is the same as in in package.json. Explanation can be found here: <https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/configuring>

___options.description: Options given to @babel/preset-env. With this options the output type of babel can be defined. For details see here: <https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-preset-env#options>. They can be overridden per target.

___plugins.description: List of additional babel plugins to enable, eg TC39 proposals; note that some proposals will work out of the box and some will require upgrades to QxCompiler before they work properly - your mileage may vary.  Each key in this object is the NPM name of the plugin, and the value is either true (enabled), false (ignore), or an object which is options to pass to the preset

___bundle.description: Allows you to use wildcards to select classes which are to be bundled together into as few files as possible

___include.description: An array of namespaces to include in the bundle. Can contain wildcards.

___exclude.description: An array of namespaces to exclude from the bundle. Can contain wildcards.

___targetClass.description: If you want to use more than the two default target types and/or use custom target classes, you can use the targetClass key to supply the name of the class as a string.

___type.description: Either `source`, `build`, or a class name in qooxdoo-compiler; using a class name is advanced usage, but ultimately the standard names just shortcuts to class names anyway (`source` is `qx.tool.compiler.targets.SourceTarget`, etc)

$eref.description: Allows you to use wildcards to select classes which are to be bundled together into as few files as possible

___include.description: An array of namespaces to include in the bundle. Can contain wildcards.

___exclude.description: An array of namespaces to exclude from the bundle. Can contain wildcards.

___minify.description: Determines the minification to be used for applications, if the target supports it; can be overridden on a per application basis. Can be off, minify, mangle, or beautify.

___uri.description: this sets the URI used to access the target output directory, i.e. the directory which will contain resources/ and transpiled/

___typescript.description: When true, output the typescript definition into ``./compiled/source/qooxdoo.d.ts`. If you use a string instead of true, the string is the name of the file which is generated inside the target output directory

___babelOptions.description: Options given to @babel/preset-env. With this options the output type of babel can be defined. For details see here: <https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-preset-env#options>. They can be overridden per target.

___addCreatedAt.description: If true, this will cause every object to have a hidden property called $$createdAt which points to an object containing filename, lineNumber, and column properties.

___application-types.description: The application types which this target supports

___description.description: A description of the target's function.

___include.description: A list of class glob patterns to include in this part.

___exclude.description: A list of class glob patterns to exclude from this part.

$eref.description: Each part has an include array which is a list of classes (including wildcards) that are to be included.

___application-names.description: The application names which this target supports

___writeCompileInfo.description: if true, the target will write a compile-info.json and resources.json into the application's output directory, containing the data structures required to generate an application

___outputPath.description: The folder where the compilation outputs to, and will be created if it does not already exist

___libraries.description: If you don't specify a libraries key, then by default the current directory will be used (provided that there is a Manifest.json file) as a library; this makes sense for most applications.

___application.description: The name of the application, as specified in the applications[] array

___ignores.description: An array of names which the compiler should ignore. Same as @ignore in source code

___exclude.description: An array of class names which are to be excluded from the application, regardless of whether the compiler thinks that they are needed. Wildcards are supported by adding a *. Note that exclude takes priority over include

___writeAllTranslations.description: By default, only translation strings which are used by the classes are included into the application.

___serve.description: Configure the qx compilers built-in webserver

___$schema.description: the json schema of the version of compile.json

___compiler.description: Which SASS compiler to use (default is deprecated "legacy" during v6, will default to "latest" in v7)

___jsx.description: Options given to @babel/preset-react to change how JSX HTML is transpiled

___applications.description: Each entry describes an application to be compiled.

___theme.description: The theme class for the application

___loaderTemplate.description: The boot loader template file, usually determined automatically from the application type

___title.description: The human readable, customer facing name used to set the <title> tag of the application web page, i.e. in the application's index.html

___bootPath.description: The URI used to access the application directory, i.e. the directory containing boot.js and resource.js

___default.description: If true, this application is considered the default when serving the application; if not provided then the first browser app is the default application. When applications are generated, each application has it's own directory inside the target directory and also has it's own index.html. However, there is an index.html which is generated in the target output directory that runs the `default` application.

___exclude.description: An array of class names which are to be excluded from the application, regardless of whether the compiler thinks that they are needed. Wildcards are supported by adding a *. Note that exclude takes priority over include

___name.description: An arbitrary, but unique, short name for the application. Should be filename and URL friendly - IE no spaces or special characters

___description.description: A description of what the application does. This information is displayed in the package browser.

___standalone.description: Whether this application can be opened in a browser on its own (true) or is part of a different application (false)

___include.description: A list of class glob patterns to include in this part.

___exclude.description: A list of class glob patterns to exclude from this part.

$eref.description: Each part has an include array which is a list of classes (including wildcards) that are to be included.

___include.description: An array of class names which are to be included in the compilation, regardless of whether the compiler can detect if they are needed (for example, your application dynamically choose class names on the fly). Wildcards are supported by adding a *.

___class.description: The class name of the main application class (it typically inherits from `qx.application.Standalone` for web applications)

___publish.description: Whether this application is to be shown in viewers like qooxdoo's package browser or not (if, e.g., it doesn't work as a standalone demo or is an internal test app which is not for general consumption). Defaults to true.

___outputPath.description: The directory to place the application files (e.g. boot.js and resource.js), relative to the target output directory

___include.description: A list of class glob patterns to include in this part.

___exclude.description: A list of class glob patterns to exclude from this part.

___parts.description: Each part has an include array which is a list of classes (including wildcards) that are to be included.

___include.description: An array of class names which are to be included in the compilation, regardless of whether the compiler can detect if they are needed (for example, your application dynamically choose class names on the fly). Wildcards are supported by adding a *.

___^\\S+$.description: virtual path as seen from the browser

___path-mappings.description: generic means to locate files on disk inside the URI address space of the application
